name: create_reminder
description: Creates a new reminder. Cannot create reminders in the past.

title.description: The title of the reminder. Short description of what to be reminded about.

start_date.description: Scheduled date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Must be current date or future.

end_date.description: End date for recurring reminders in YYYY-MM-DD format. Must be >= start_date.

repeat_every_n.description: Number of repeat intervals. Defaults to 0.

repeat_interval_unit.description: Unit of repeat intervals. Accepts MINUTE, HOUR, DAY, WEEK, MONTH, YEAR in any case (e.g., 'minute', 'MINUTE', 'Minute').

days_of_week.description:
Days of week for recurring reminders.
Accepts SUNDAY, MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, or SATURDAY in any case (e.g., 'monday', 'MONDAY', or 'Monday').

weeks_of_month.description:
Weeks of month for recurring reminders.
Accepts FIRST, SECOND, THIRD, FOURTH, LAST, or the numeric strings '1'-'5'.

days_of_month.description:
Days of month for recurring reminders. 
Accepts DAY_1, DAY_2, DAY_3, DAY_4, DAY_5, DAY_6, DAY_7, DAY_8, DAY_9, DAY_10, DAY_11, DAY_12, DAY_13, DAY_14, DAY_15, DAY_16, DAY_17, DAY_18, DAY_19, DAY_20, DAY_21, DAY_22, DAY_23, DAY_24, DAY_25, DAY_26, DAY_27, DAY_28, DAY_29, DAY_30, DAY_31, or the numeric strings '1'-'31'.
Case-insensitive for DAY_X format (e.g., 'day_5', 'Day_10', 'DAY_15' are all valid).
Use LAST if the user wants the reminder to be scheduled on the last day of the month.

occurrence_count.description: Number of times reminder should recur.

name: get_reminders
description: Fetch reminders context. This is an internal function not visible to the model.

from_date.description: Start date filter in YYYY-MM-DD format.

from_time_of_day.description: Start time filter in hh:mm:ss format.

to_date.description: End date filter in YYYY-MM-DD format.

to_time_of_day.description: End time filter in hh:mm:ss format.

is_recurring.description: Whether to filter for recurring reminders only.

name: modify_reminder
description: Search for reminders and modify them. At least one of `reminder_ids` or `retrieval_query` must be provided.

retrieval_query.description: Query to find reminders to modify. Keys include:

ask_for_confirmation.description: Whether to ask for user confirmation.

is_bulk_mutation.description: Whether this is a bulk operation on multiple reminders.

start_date.description: New start date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

end_date.description: New end date for recurring reminders.

repeat_interval_unit.description: New repeat interval unit. Accepts values in any case (e.g., 'minute', 'MINUTE', 'Minute').

days_of_week.description:
Days of week for recurring reminders.
Accepts SUNDAY, MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, or SATURDAY in any case (e.g., 'monday', 'MONDAY', or 'Monday').

weeks_of_month.description:
Weeks of month for recurring reminders.
Accepts FIRST, SECOND, THIRD, FOURTH, LAST, or the numeric strings '1'-'5'.

days_of_month.description:
Days of month for recurring reminders. 
Accepts DAY_1, DAY_2, DAY_3, DAY_4, DAY_5, DAY_6, DAY_7, DAY_8, DAY_9, DAY_10, DAY_11, DAY_12, DAY_13, DAY_14, DAY_15, DAY_16, DAY_17, DAY_18, DAY_19, DAY_20, DAY_21, DAY_22, DAY_23, DAY_24, DAY_25, DAY_26, DAY_27, DAY_28, DAY_29, DAY_30, DAY_31, or the numeric strings '1'-'31'.
Case-insensitive for DAY_X format (e.g., 'day_5', 'Day_10', 'DAY_15' are all valid).
Use LAST if the user wants the reminder to be scheduled on the last day of the month.

name: show_matching_reminders
description: Search for and show matching reminders to the user. When using reminder_ids, deleted reminders are included. When using retrieval_query, deleted reminders are excluded by default unless include_deleted=True.

reminder_ids.description: Specific reminder IDs to show. Deleted reminders will be included.

retrieval_query.description: Query to find reminders to show. Keys include:

name: undo
description: Revert reminder operations from the last turn of conversation.
